commit_message:
Eventlet service fixed

eventlet_service is designed to test ProcessLauncher in pair with
eventlet server. As long as ProcessLauncher uses cfg.CONF.config_file
option we need to register it. This option can be register with
cfg.CONF() call.

Change-Id: I8c3a557f66d8f1db8733d04dd7793425188ee29c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service refs/changes/39/192239/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Install iptables-services dependency on Fedora

This patch installs the iptables-services package on Fedora. Without
this dependency the systemd files to start/stop/enable iptables
will not be present.

Change-Id: I822344a7ce394e6054dafe1aa5c34dad7c70c252
Closes-Bug: #1465250

commit_message:
Remove raise Timeout::Error from ntp_available

The ntp_available function should not raise a Timeout::Error here as
it should just return false so that the next server should be checked.
This update addresses the case where a Timeout::Error is being raised
rather than having all servers checked before erroring with a
Puppet::Error if no servers answer.

Change-Id: Ibf2ebb80c04e4314f01b9a45e6a2169e1cde7fbf
Closes-Bug: 1465598

commit_message:
Add galera-mysql cluster support openstack-common

1. Add a new db service_type as 'galera'
2. Reuse compatible code for mysql to support 'galera'

Change-Id: I7de9a7eab3523d8acdf4627a571335b59be0e0ee
Implements: blueprint galera-and-percona-support

commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the new
rspec-puppet release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax
in order to be prepared for rspec 3.x move.

In details:

  * Use shared_examples "a Puppet::Error" for puppet::error tests
  * Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x)
  * Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
  * Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
  * Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Conflicts:
	Gemfile
	spec/classes/ceilometer_db_postgresql_spec.rb
	spec/classes/ceilometer_db_spec.rb

Change-Id: Ieaff6bc8bdd8548648ff5e76b212d4df382fa8a3
Card: https://trello.com/c/eHXc1Ryd/4-investigate-the-necessary-change-to-be-rspec-puppet-2-0-0-compliant
(cherry picked from commit 55b7aad8cf0c902cd1469da8547f24e856b06de4)

commit_message:
Add oslo.policy namespace

As we have used oslo.policy, so we need to add that in
namespace, as oslo.policy has many settings. This followed
other projects genconfig ways.

Partially-implements: blueprint policy-enforce
Change-Id: I83cce25427b65aad6d26f4ea2d6a48170233a4f3

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fix serial port issue on Windows Threshold

On Windows Threshold, a new WMI class was introduced, targeting
VM serial ports.

For this reason, attempting to retrieve serial port connections
fails on Windows Threshold.

This patch fixes the issue by adding an extra check and using the
right WMI class in order to retrieve VM serial ports.

Closes-Bug: #1466056

Change-Id: Ibaf6ac2e77b6324538c6f3dbaacab2a5f065b4ce
(cherry picked from commit 3518220e6313201d5582f14ad73c734453bbe23a)

commit_message:
Added Lint job (nonvoting) to horizon-check

This patch switches horizon from using an explicitly declared
npm run job, to using the javascript-jobs template. It also
adds the `npm run lint` job to the check queue.

Change-Id: I122a7fba04dfba0e036be9b6ccd52d60c1cc36a9
Depends-on: I2c92a7596a8faee28de582493bdf72425deac8cc

commit_message:
Add uname -a to net-info macro

Having the kernel and hostname in the console output is very helpful,
as devstack-gate only outputs this during the setup phase, which is
redirected to a log file ... but if the job fails and the logs aren't
copied, you can't figure this out.

Change-Id: I88630619d03cd35c815953e67f40d5e8b148af3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/43/191243/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo "Host & kernel" uname -a

commit_message:
Ensure netfilter enabled for bridges with OVS Hybrid

The OVS Hybrid driver implements security groups by using netfilter on
an intermediate Linux bridge.  Unfortunately distributions differ on
the default status of this (Ubuntu has it on, Red Hat off, at least).

Neutron is unwilling to set this up itself
(If2d316eb8c422dc1e4f34b17a50b93dd72993a99) but I have a review out to
detect this situation and halt the agent
(I8b49298d27a75a864c0066896cbd3d3095982f6e).

This change enables the setting, and does some minimal work to
configure the system to have it enabled.  This is analgous to what is
done in other deployment mechanisms such as packstack and fuel, and
also what is suggested in the documentation.

Change-Id: Ia508c552d806363f6633d0bcd357c05bf956279f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/46/188646/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # the "hybrid" driver implements security groups by creating a # linux bridge and setting up netfilter rules on it, because # ovs bridges aren't compatible with netfilter at the moment. # Unfortunately, getting this enabled everywhere is a real # mess. # this ensures bridge module is loaded brctl show # firstly, later kernels (~3.18) have split these bridge-nf* # nodes out into br_netfilter module, so see if we can load # that if sudo modprobe br_netfilter; then # try to make sure system loads this at boot if [[ -d /etc/modules-load.d ]]; then echo "br_netfilter" | sudo tee /etc/modules-load.d/br_netfilter.conf elif [[ -f /etc/modules && \ ! grep -q 'br_netfilter' /etc/modules ]]; then echo "br_netfilter" | sudo tee -a /etc/modules fi fi # if we haven't added them to sysctl.conf, add them now if ! grep -q '# devstack ovs hybrid bridge setup' /etc/sysctl.conf; then echo "# devstack ovs hybrid bridge setup" | sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf echo "net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-arptables=1" | sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf echo "net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables=1" | sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf echo "net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables=1" | sudo tee -a /etc/sysctl.conf fi # apply the settings sudo sysctl -p /etc/sysctl.conf

commit_message:
Add Neutron Loadbalancer v1 create and delete pools

Enable benchmarking of the Neutron LoadBalancer v1
lb-pool-create and lb-pool-delete APIs. Due to the
different API scheme and confusing naming conventions
in Neutron (LB is v1 API and LBaaS for v2 API) the
appropriate code is explicitly marked with 'v1'
since this only implements the API v1 benchmarking.

Change-Id: I83acf4971689f07aab8af5ed6b01d59777529e2e

commit_message:
Add a non-voting py34 check job to Swift

I was asked to add the Python 3.4 check job to Swift even if tests
doesn't pass right now on Python 3.4. It was decided during Swift
meeting of the 2015-06-10:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/swift/2015/swift.2015-06-10-21.00.html

Only add the check job to the master branch, ignore Kilo branches and
older since they will not get Python 3 support.

Change-Id: Ib33138be0c6351c882543252a914fd2508247372
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/00/190700/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Convergence: move temp_update_requires functionality to tests

During intial stages of convergence to simulate the entire cycle
some part of worker code was written in stack.py.
Now that the convergence worker is implemented, this code needs to
be executed only in tests.

Moved it to proper location.

Change-Id: I52f1611d34def3474acba0e5eee054e11c5fc5ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/12/192212/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fixes a bug on the iLO driver tutorial
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-17 03:21:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/9bbeacb97ce35696086e7318b643a20bad3bf194', 'message': 'Implements: Fixes a bug on the iLO driver tutorial.
Closes-Bug: #1465910

Change-Id: I6cd24b68deacbb9da022a4e34ae607b5c9c950a4
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-17 03:24:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/b7694ab41b288ab128ae2b92cc82d3e7d5f0fb84', 'message': 'Implements: Fixes a bug on the iLO driver tutorial.
Closes-Bug: #1465910

There is a wrong command on the iLO Ironic driver tutorial page. 
The command is in the "Registering Proliant node in Ironic" session 
(http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/drivers/ilo.html#id31), 
it is used to create a Ironic node that should use the iLO driver, 
so there are some parameters to be passed in the command. 
The problem is the lack of the "-i" argument just before the 
"ilo_address" and "deploy_ramdisk" parameters. The solution is to add 
the "-i" argument just before the "ilo_address" and "deploy_ramdisk" 
keys.

By following a tutorial, the reader often copy the commands and small 
pieces of code that are provided by the tutorial itself, in doing so, 
when the copied part has a problem the error just delaying and sometimes 
difficult to understand the process causing a waste of time on debugging 
the problems that should not exist.

This patch solves the problem by adding the "-i" argument on the command
in ilo.rst file.

Change-Id: I6cd24b68deacbb9da022a4e34ae607b5c9c950a4
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-17 03:33:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/2efacaf01518b8e4456086dca591ba779b18c096', 'message': 'Fixes a bug on the iLO driver tutorial. bug/#1465910

There is a wrong command on the iLO Ironic driver tutorial page. 
The command is in the "Registering Proliant node in Ironic" session 
(http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/drivers/ilo.html#id31), 
it is used to create a Ironic node that should use the iLO driver, 
so there are some parameters to be passed in the command. 
The problem is the lack of the "-i" argument just before the 
"ilo_address" and "deploy_ramdisk" parameters. The solution is to add 
the "-i" argument just before the "ilo_address" and "deploy_ramdisk" 
keys.

By following a tutorial, the reader often copy the commands and small 
pieces of code that are provided by the tutorial itself, in doing so, 
when the copied part has a problem the error just delaying and sometimes 
difficult to understand the process causing a waste of time on debugging 
the problems that should not exist.

This patch solves the problem by adding the "-i" argument on the command
in ilo.rst file.

commit_message:
Fixes a bug on the iLO driver tutorial

There is a wrong command on the iLO Ironic driver tutorial page.
The command is in the "Registering Proliant node in Ironic" session
(http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/drivers/ilo.html#id31),
it is used to create a Ironic node that should use the iLO driver,
so there are some parameters to be passed in the command.
The problem is the lack of the "-i" argument just before the
"ilo_address" and "deploy_ramdisk" parameters. The solution is to add
the "-i" argument just before the "ilo_address" and "deploy_ramdisk"
keys.

By following a tutorial, the reader often copy the commands and small
pieces of code that are provided by the tutorial itself, in doing so,
when the copied part has a problem the error just delaying and sometimes
difficult to understand the process causing a waste of time on debugging
the problems that should not exist.

This patch solves the problem by adding the "-i" argument on the command
in ilo.rst file.

Closes-Bug: #1465910

Change-Id: I6cd24b68deacbb9da022a4e34ae607b5c9c950a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/09/192509/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ironic node-create -d pxe_ilo -i ilo_address=<ilo-ip-address> -i ilo_username=<ilo-username> -i ilo_password=<ilo-password> -i deploy_kernel=<glance-uuid-of-pxe-deploy-kernel> -i deploy_ramdisk=<glance-uuid-of-deploy-ramdisk>
deleted_lines: ironic node-create -d pxe_ilo ilo_address=<ilo-ip-address> -i ilo_username=<ilo-username> -i ilo_password=<ilo-password> -i deploy_kernel=<glance-uuid-of-pxe-deploy-kernel> deploy_ramdisk=<glance-uuid-of-deploy-ramdisk>

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fix serial port issue on Windows Threshold

On Windows Threshold, a new WMI class was introduced, targeting
VM serial ports.

For this reason, attempting to retrieve serial port connections
fails on Windows Threshold.

This patch fixes the issue by adding an extra check and using the
right WMI class in order to retrieve VM serial ports.

Closes-Bug: #1466056

Change-Id: Ibaf6ac2e77b6324538c6f3dbaacab2a5f065b4ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/compute-hyperv refs/changes/33/192633/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: mock_vmsettings[0].associators.assert_called_once_with( wmi_result_class=self._vmutils._SERIAL_PORT_SETTING_DATA_CLASS)

commit_message:
Disable user before deleting

The keystone team suggests disabling resources before deleting to spread
out the cost and to mitigate risk of failure.

Co-Authored-By: Haneef Ali <haneef.ali@hp.com>
Change-Id: I9e61a275c6dd4fb946de742c84263e228ec18136

subject: Remove raise Timeout::Error from ntp_available
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-17 11:23:50.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/puppet/parser/functions/ntp_available.rb'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/14ac1f7025e7490975f8156f351f35d42b1f3672', 'message': 'Remove raise Timeout::Error from ntp_available

THIS COMMIT IS identical to Ibf2ebb80c04e4314f01b9a45e6a2169e1cde7fbf
it was created to override -1 workflow as we need to merge stuff
for 6.1 RC3

The ntp_available function should not raise a Timeout::Error here as
it should just return false so that the next server should be checked.
This update addresses the case where a Timeout::Error is being raised
rather than having all servers checked before erroring with a
Puppet::Error if no servers answer.

Change-Id: Ide224a0e5dffca6b3dcb8c5e12b732870d07b988
Closes-Bug: 1465598
'}]
commit_message:
Remove raise Timeout::Error from ntp_available

THIS COMMIT IS identical to Ibf2ebb80c04e4314f01b9a45e6a2169e1cde7fbf
it was created to override -1 workflow as we need to merge stuff
for 6.1 RC3

The ntp_available function should not raise a Timeout::Error here as
it should just return false so that the next server should be checked.
This update addresses the case where a Timeout::Error is being raised
rather than having all servers checked before erroring with a
Puppet::Error if no servers answer.

Change-Id: Ide224a0e5dffca6b3dcb8c5e12b732870d07b988
Closes-Bug: 1465598

commit_message:
Add possibility to set dhcp options with enabled q-l3 service

Currently, it's not possible to change values of Neutron's
dhcp options: enable_isolated_metadata and enable_metadata_network
if q-l3 service is enabled, but user should be able to do this.

Change-Id: I95efa39b4b14a0bf567964f007b25b97f1124e7b
Closes-Bug: #1463020

commit_message:
remove hack for nova bug

nova had a bug - it didn't delete root volume of EBS instance.
Now nova can do it so we don't need to cleanup volumes.

Change-Id: I0ed961716b2bc1924d65a20846a7fe3f6fc6c367

commit_message:
Refactor pip check/install & add dependency for CentOS

Use easy_install to install pip to avoid additional dependencies
on CentOS. Refactor the check for an installed pip since it will
now be the same in both OS families.

env-setup.sh was missing a package required if the user is
starting from a very basic CentOS install.

Also fix a minor typo in the script.

Change-Id: I1ee783862b2bc5ad8b5df442ed7ca25732d8f706

Add rally.common.plugin.discover module

Move all related to plugins from utils to discover module
and fix the code and tests to make it work

deleted_lines: import impimport osfrom oslo_utils import importutilsimport rallydef itersubclasses(cls, _seen=None): """Generator over all subclasses of a given class in depth first order.""" if not isinstance(cls, type): raise TypeError(_("itersubclasses must be called with " "new-style classes, not %.100r") % cls) _seen = _seen or set() try: subs = cls.__subclasses__() except TypeError: # fails only when cls is type subs = cls.__subclasses__(cls) for sub in subs: if sub not in _seen: _seen.add(sub) yield sub for sub in itersubclasses(sub, _seen): yield sub def try_append_module(name, modules): if name not in modules: modules[name] = importutils.import_module(name) def import_modules_from_package(package): """Import modules from package and append into sys.modules :param: package - Full package name. For example: rally.deploy.engines """ path = [os.path.dirname(rally.__file__), ".."] + package.split(".") path = os.path.join(*path) for root, dirs, files in os.walk(path): for filename in files: if filename.startswith("__") or not filename.endswith(".py"): continue new_package = ".".join(root.split(os.sep)).split("....")[1] module_name = "%s.%s" % (new_package, filename[:-3]) try_append_module(module_name, sys.modules) def load_plugins(dir_or_file): if os.path.isdir(dir_or_file): directory = dir_or_file LOG.info("Loading plugins from directories %s/*" % directory) to_load = [] for root, dirs, files in os.walk(directory): to_load.extend((plugin[:-3], root) for plugin in files if plugin.endswith(".py")) for plugin, directory in to_load: if directory not in sys.path: sys.path.append(directory) fullpath = os.path.join(directory, plugin) try: fp, pathname, descr = imp.find_module(plugin, [directory]) imp.load_module(plugin, fp, pathname, descr) fp.close() LOG.info("\t Loaded module with plugins: %s.py" % fullpath) except Exception as e: LOG.warning( "\t Failed to load module with plugins %(path)s.py: %(e)s" % {"path": fullpath, "e": e}) if logging.is_debug(): LOG.exception(e) elif os.path.isfile(dir_or_file): plugin_file = dir_or_file LOG.info("Loading plugins from file %s" % plugin_file) if plugin_file not in sys.path: sys.path.append(plugin_file) try: plugin_name = os.path.splitext(plugin_file.split("/")[-1])[0] imp.load_source(plugin_name, plugin_file) LOG.info("\t Loaded module with plugins: %s.py" % plugin_name) except Exception as e: LOG.warning( "\t Failed to load module with plugins %(path)s: %(e)s" % {"path": plugin_file, "e": e}) if logging.is_debug(): LOG.exception(e)

commit_message:
Dual Scoped Token

This is the new away to provide a token for a project with the is_domain
feature enabled.

Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte Sousa <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Henrique Truta <henrique@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

bp dual-scoped-token

Change-Id: I03f9b01f0088cfd0b670a4e8b36e01f2c16739c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone-specs refs/changes/54/176054/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================= Dual Scoped Token ================= `bp dual-scoped_token <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/dual-scoped-token>`_ With the implementation of Reseller, there is a new concept for domain, that is now considered a feature of project, i.e. a project with is_domain feature is a single entity that behaves as a domain and a project. We need a new call to request a token for a project with is_domain feature, Keystone must provide a dual scoped token, this will be a token that will have project and domain scope at the same time. Problem Description =================== Use Case: **Actor** * Alex - Domain admin in a parent_project with is_domain feature enabled. * Sam - Project admin in a sub_project with is_domain feature disabled. Given the project hierarchy as follows:: parent_project (with is_domain feature) / sub_project Today, If Alex user wants to create a user in the parent_project, he needs to use a domain scoped token, however, if Alex wants to create an instance in parent_project (the same entity) in Nova, Alex needs to issue another kind of token, a project scoped token. Another problem is that, in the current implementation, he is able to grant a role for Sam in parent_project as a domain and grant the same role, but as a project assignment. Proposed Change =============== Change the domain scoped token request to provide a dual scoped token, i. e., when the user request a domain scoped token for a project with is_domain feature enabled, Keystone will return a token valid for domain and project scopes. Now that a domain is a feature of projects, if we assign a user in a project with is_domain feature, this assignment will be valid for the project and domain scopes, for example, If we add a role assignment for a user X with the role “admin” in a project A with domain feature, this user can get a project scoped token, or a domain scoped token for project A, as “admin” with just one assignment. We will simplify the assignments types, after that will exist just two types: USER_PROJECT and GROUP_PROJECT. Beyond that, we will migrate all the current domain assignments to the USER_PROJECT or GROUP_PROJECT type. Alternatives ------------ Keep requesting tokens just for project or domain scope, for this the user needs to explicitly specify in the token request whether the project has the is_domain feature. Security Impact --------------- None Notifications Impact -------------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other Deployer Impact --------------------- None Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <raildo> Other contributors: <rodrigods> <htruta> Work Items ---------- * Create a USER_PROJECT and a GROUP_PROJECT role assignment for each USER_DOMAIN and GROUP_DOMAIN existing. * Remove the USER_DOMAIN and GROUP_DOMAIN assignments types. * When a domain scoped token is requested for a project with the ``is_domain`` flag active, a dual scoped token will be provided, referencing the project which holds that domain. Dependencies ============ * The Reseller code that is already implemented. Documentation Impact ==================== * Change the Keystone API to explain the new return for a domain scoped token. * Explain that a role assignment for a project with is_domain feature, will be valid for project and domain scoped tokens. References ========== `Reseller <https://blueprints.launchpad.net/keystone/+spec/reseller>`_

commit_message:
Add action type 'run_tasks' for patching tests

For some product patches (e.g. fix in service configuration)
it's necessary to run deployment tasks on slaves after
updating fixed packages. Adding new action type 'run_task'
for that.

Change-Id: I7476e7d4d40cba54b2e12176f6584acdb56b4b95
Implements: blueprint mos-patching-tests
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/00/192600/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
